CatDescriptText: Alice Whitehead, South Park and Carolyn Lemon, Belle Vernon, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that men should marry women within their own age bracket (not over fiver years difference) or do you approve of 'May and December' marriages?" Alice Whitehead's answer reads: "If there's love, it doesn't matter who's the older or the younger." Carolyn Lemon's answer reads: "I don't believe in 'May and December marriages...The ages of the parties depend on whether or not the male is mature enough...."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Alice Whitehead, and Carolyn Lemon wearing floral jacket with large pleated collar, holding dark handbag, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
